page.title: 11EDUCATION-GALSTON
page.content: Galston has 3 schools;St.Sophias, Galston Primary and Loudoun Academy. Galston Primary opened as a free school in 1949,first as a Junior Secondary,then as a High School in 1969.In 1970 it was made solely a Primary school and pupils over 12 moved onto Loudoun Academy.The school now has a role of 516 pupils.St. Sophias opened in 1958 as a free school for children of the Catholic faith.The school has a present role of 125 pupils.The role has been decreasing steadily over the last 5 years.Pupils of St.Sophias move on to St.Josephs Secondary school at the age of 12.Loudoun Academy opened in 1971 taking pupils from the Valley.The present role is 1300.Of all the pupils who left Loudoun in 1984/85,4% became unemployed,71% employed,25% to Further Education.
